column3: of King Tar-Elendil of Númenor. In his youth
column4: Írimon was fascinated by the stars
column5: and he removed to the heights of the northern Forostar
column6: where they were more clearly visible. There he built a watch-tower among the highlands to follow the movements of the heavens. When he succeeded his father as King
column7: he left his star-tower and returned to Armenelos
column9: where he took the Sceptre in the name of Tar-Meneldur (where Meneldur means devoted to the heavens).
